comment: Dr. Dean is a really great teacher. She's very helpful and her lectures are clear. There's a lot of online work butbas long as you keep up, it's a pretty easy class.

During this class after turning in a lab I would get it back and it would be easy to see where I messed up. Many times it was because I rushed through something or simply did not pay attention. Dr. Dean was great whenever I went to see her and get help and she was continually straightforward with what she wanted.

She seems like a nice enough lady, but counts off for everything. She had never done any of the labs before so there was no experience or someone to turn to. Lab was supposed to be the easy part but i ended up making a D because of her ridiculous grading. If you can try to avoid her please do it will make your life so much easier.

She made several errors and would have to go back and correct herself or a student would correct her. Expect to learn straight from the book to study. She has an extremely high fail rate, so just avoid altogether. She also gives extra credit, but it doesn't help when she counts it in, so don't rely on that. Didn't feel prepared for the ACS Final.
very, very unclear when it comes to working out problems. She will do problems one way for one problem set and then a completely different way for the next.

Dr. Dean is very very nice. She helps if you use her office hours, but her tests are super tough. Even when you feel like you aced a test, you may get a 70. The test questions are not as clear as the homework, but I could've done more on my part. I would take her again, not eagerly, but i would.
She is really helpful and uses OWL for homework. She may give slightly less time for tests but it only matters when there is heavy math. She is a really nice person. I would take her again!
Tests are impossible, lectures and powerpoints are unclear. She makes constant mistakes in grading and during her lectures. DO NOT take her if you want to pass.

I took honors chem in high school and had over a 100 in the class. Took chem with her despite reading the other feedback and regret not changing out. Terrible teacher, nice woman and will help during office hours but her tests and nothing like the endless amounts of homework given. Would NEVER recommend
Her tests are stupid hard. She gives you all the practice work and then its completely different on the test. I would not recommend this professor

She is very helpful, gives practice exams and extra credit opportunities. She moves at a fast pace and has a quiz every week. She curves the quizzes, but not the tests. Very nice lady and very intelligent, but very hard class. Even studying for hours I made a 48 on a test. You have to be willing to study everyday for this class.

Do not take her. She is very disorganized and makes mistakes constantly. Even on test she will forget to give the info needed. She has a million excuses and will teach you wrong. So if you are good at chem avoid. And she will not give you credit if there is an error on the test.

The material is 100% understandable. Dr. Dean just happens to rush through the material as if one were to have a prior understanding. The book WILL help tremendously beyond belief. Pencasts are okay, if you like to have time to double check your tests do NOT take her. You are only provided a short amount of time for thorough test questions.

Good prof but this is material u really must teach yourself. Pencasts are great&she's helpful@office hours. Many opps to pump up your grade. I made a D,C,B,on tests then an A on the last test&final for an A in the class. Drops lowest test grade, material gets easier as u go. Don't let this class be the reason you drop out of being a science major!!

Overall,not a bad class, she was very nice and easy to approach and helpful. There were online quizzes every other week, exams weren't impossible, there is a take home section on the exams. All her power points are online, the pencasts are great! Basically she gives you everything you need to pass the class. You just have to study and do the work.

Dr. Dean is very nice and helpful! She tries to her best to allow every student to succeed. However she can get behind and will rush through the lesson and it really messes you up on the tests. She drops your lowest test grade. She also uses Pencast's which are really helpful. If your good at chemistry you'll get an A. If you struggle, a B or C.

Do not take her. As others have stated she is a nice lady... but this is a chemistry class, and you are a good professor if you inspire your students to learn and present the material in a clear way. She routinely makes mistakes on homework, study guides, and in class. I am not impressed with her at all. Not to mention her tests are poorly written.

She tries to help and is decently nice but she makes a lot of mistakes on the quizzes and in class. The tests are ten times harder than the material you learn in class. Lets you drop one tests grade so thats pretty cool. All in all, she's not awful and she wants to help you if you want to be helped. My opinion of her is neutral.

LOVE Dr. Dean! I was really nervous about taking chemistry but she made it so easy! Tons of quizzes and busy work, but they help your grade a lot. After each quiz is graded she lets you resubmit them to get back 1/2 the points you missed. Always willing to help if you go to her office, wish I could have had her for chem II. Curves the final grade.
She wasn't the best. Even if she sees people trying she will still fail you. The only thing I can say is that she tries to help her students.

She is eager to help and her online Pencasts are helpful, but  I did not like her teaching approach. And she doesn't give enough time for quizzes and sometimes test. I'm having to retake her. If you've already had Chem in high school, you might be ok. If not TAKE SOMEONE ELSE.

She is sooo easy. Easier than my high school chemistry class. I did well in her class, but don't worry if you aren't doing well cause there is such a curve at the end. I ended up with over a 100 in her class.

At first i thought this was going to be a easy teacher, but as the semester went on it just became harder and harder. I was in her 50 minute class and she did not give enough time for the tests at all. If you are a slow test taker i do not recommend this teacher. Or if you like to review your test, you will not have time.

Ms. Dean is so nice! She is brand new to KSU so she has been figuring a lot of her stuff out this semester. She is so helpful. After I got a bad grade on the first test she let me come to her almost everyday. She wants her students to succeed. Take her if you want to learn a lot and need a little help in chemistry.
